definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

Deng Xiaoping's four modernizations practiced from the 1980s (possibly planned together with Zhou Enlai), namely: modernization of industry, agriculture, national defense and science and technology/abbr. to 四化
modernization of national defense, one of Deng Xiaoping's Four Modernizations
modernization of industry, one of Deng Xiaoping's Four Modernizations
modernization of science and technology, one of Deng Xiaoping's Four Modernizations
pinyin: ke1 xue2 ji4 shu4 xian4 dai4 hua4

definition: fifth modernization, i.e. democracy, cf Deng Xiaoping's Four Modernizations 鄧小平|邓小平, 四個現代化|四个现代化
pinyin: di4 wu3 ge4 xian4 dai4 hua4

definition: modernization of agriculture, one of Deng Xiaoping's Four Modernizations

sentences.english: Zhou Gucheng concerns himself with Chinas modernization from the period of the War of Resistence Against Japan.
sentences.chinese: 從抗戰時期起周谷城就關心國家的現代化問題。

sentences.english: He Lin recognized the necessity of modernization of philosophical methodology.
sentences.chinese: 賀麟清醒的認識到哲學方法論現代化的必要性。

sentences.english: Therefore, neoteric peasant movements are the major impetus of Chinas earlier modernization.
sentences.chinese: 因此，近代農民運動是中國早期現代化的主要推動力。

sentences.english: USS New Jersey BB-62 after the 1968 modernization.
sentences.chinese: 1968年經過現代化改裝後的新澤西號戰列艦。

sentences.english: Many farming techniques will have been modernised.
sentences.chinese: 很多農業技術會實現現代化。

sentences.english: A modern office building is standing on the site of the old bookstore.
sentences.chinese: 一座現代化辦公大樓矗立在這家書店的故址上。

sentences.english: E-billing as one of modern logistics enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 電子商務結算爲一體的現代化物流企業。

sentences.english: They cancel out the benefits of modernization. They break the bank.
sentences.chinese: 它們將抵消現代化的益處，並將耗盡資財。

sentences.english: Modem educational aids would be used with great facility.
sentences.chinese: 現代化的教輔工具使用非常便利。

sentences.english: Modernization of the Chinese traditional opera is a focus of Zhang Geng's life-long exploration of drama.
sentences.chinese: 戲曲現代化是張庚先生一生戲劇探索的重心。

sentences.english: A beautiful ecological environment is the sign of a city with modern civilization.
sentences.chinese: 優美的生態環境是現代化文明城市的重要標誌。

sentences.english: None of us, including the veteran comrades, is sufficiently capable of directing modern wars.
sentences.chinese: 指揮現代化戰爭，包括我們老同志在內，能力都不夠。

sentences.english: Today, Beijing has already developed into a modern international metropolis.
sentences.chinese: 今日的北京，更已發展成爲一座現代化的國際大都市。

sentences.english: One of the symbol of the banks' modernization is the development of intermediary business (IB).
sentences.chinese: 銀行現代化的標誌之一就是中間業務的發展。

sentences.english: Zhang Hen shuis novels are closely linked with Chinese modernization.
sentences.chinese: 張恨水小說與中國的現代化有着密切聯繫。

sentences.english: The lightening is an important mark of the modernized cities.
sentences.chinese: 亮化是現代化城市的重要標誌。

definition: innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
